column5: Reaching out to my fellow OFC'ers for help.  I do volunteer work with an air cadet squadron in Mississauga, ON. We are in need of a large shipping container for storage. Preferably a 40 ft. model, but all will be considered.  We are a non profit charitable organization and can issue a tax receipt for a donation or possibly purchase a used container if the price and transportation cost are within our limited budget.  I've also thought about using an old transport trailer. 40 to 53 footer. However, this depends on whether our supporting legion will allow us to put it on their property. A shipping container's lower profile is less of an eyesore to the legion and it's neighbours and much more likely to get approval.  Something similar to the one is this link would be ideal: https://thumbs.dreamstime.com/z/shipping-container-isolated-white-realistic-vector-illustration-46849227.jpg  Anybody have a connection or idea how we can make this work ?

https://www.kijiji.ca/v-storage-parking/mississauga-peel-region/20-40-sea-storage-shipping-containers-for-sale-rent/579577699  https://www.google.com/search?q=where+to+buy+a+shipping+container+in+the+Mississauga%2C+ON+area&ie=utf-8&oe=utf-8  They seem to be available in your area, will the zoning laws of your intended location allow one? Since it is for an air cadet squadron you might get a break or donation of one? I am not sure how they would deliver one outside of a facility meant to deal with them, every time I picked one up they used a crane or huge outdoor forklift to place it on the transport frame.  You could try calling some of the listed sellers and trying for a deal?
You might want to try Borden and see where they get theirs from.  We have them scattered around for storage.

https://www.kijiji.ca/v-storage-parking/mississauga-peel-region/20-40-sea-storage-shipping-containers-for-sale-rent/579577699  https://www.google.com/search?q=where+to+buy+a+shipping+container+in+the+Mississauga%2C+ON+area&ie=utf-8&oe=utf-8  They seem to be available in your area, will the zoning laws of your intended location allow one? Since it is for an air cadet squadron you might get a break or donation of one? I am not sure how they would deliver one outside of a facility meant to deal with them, every time I picked one up they used a crane or huge outdoor forklift to place it on the transport frame.  You could try calling some of the listed sellers and trying for a deal? I've been looking online Ohio. Waiting for a couple of places to get back to me with a quote, but I doubt the numbers will be favourable for us.  You might want to try Borden and see where they get theirs from.  We have them scattered around for storage. Fisherman, I will look into that.

Try Best Choice Containers....... They are Kleinburg. South east corner of 50 and Albion- Vaughan Road. I see a sign on their fence stating they sell used containers. Not sure of their pricing.  Meely
This should be moved to announcements but since it is for a charitable cause I will let it stay here until someone complains.  Good luck with your search  Art
check out bryan's farm auction, they have some on their online auction site, the auction ends on the 27th of this month
Thanks Mike. I will definitely check it out.
